content.description: Climbs good face moves up the west wall. Worth climbing if you're in the corridor.
content.location: Furthest bolt line to the north on the west wall.

content.description: Climbs face to a seam on the east wall to the left of the big flake.
content.protection: 3 bolts, maybe gear to thin hands.

content.description: A fun, techy face route, that is tainted by bird shit.
content.location: The center route on the West side of the corridor.

content.description: This route climbs the arete on the SW side of the corridor. It's pretty stiff as a 9 and has a heady finish, but goes at the grade if you find the moves.
content.location: SW corner of the corridor. It's the last route to the south on the west wall.

content.description: Face climb to the right of the big flake that is the route "Bones".
content.location: Right most bolt line on the east wall.

content.description:
This rig is pretty wild, featuring a mega steep section of rock. Climb up a large 5.8 dihedral with easy stemming for five bolts, passing a large block wedged in the corner. The sixth, seventh, and eighth bolts have fixed draws and climb through extremely steep rock to a crux move above the eighth bolt. The last three bolts climb through slightly overhanging 5.11 territory to a triple bolt, triple steel biner lower off.

Note: The half ton block wedged half way up the dihedral was found to be solid. However, its' precarious appearance gave much pause. After a hardy struggle trying to remove it with a large crowbar to no avail, I decided to secure it with two large bolts and a short piece of high test chain.
content.protection: The route has eleven bolts, three of which are fixed draws. You need eight quickdraws to get to the anchor. The anchor consists of three fixed steel biners.
content.location: Approach by scrambling 4th class up the large boulder wedged in the notch between Rob's Rock and Dilithium Crystal. You can also tunnel under and through from the high left end of the boulder. HOD begins twenty feet left of Spock in a large, right facing dihedral. Rope up on top of the large approach boulder at the far left side of the Crystal Corridor's East wall exactly where the approach trail tops out. Just left of HOD you can see the top half of Twister. You can lower off HOD with a 60m rope.

content.description: Climbs the prominent flake up the middle of the east wall. Decent climbing, but the flake does not inspire a ton of confidence. Felt oddly alpine considering the location.
content.protection: Gear to #3. Anchor is a fixed nut and a wedged knot. There was also a manky bolt. Not the definition of bomber.
content.location: Flake up the middle of the wall. Can't miss it.
